name: instinct

C2 the way people or animals naturally react or behave, without having to think or learn about it: All his instincts told him to stay near the car and wait for help. [ + to infinitive ] Her first instinct was to run. It is instinct that tells the birds when to begin their migration.have an instinct for figurative Bob seems to have an instinct for (= is naturally good at) knowing which products will sell.

a natural ability that helps you decide what to do or how to act without thinking: [ U ] He lacked the instinct for quick action. [ C ] His biggest asset may be his political instincts.
Instinct is also the ability to behave in a particular way that has not been learned: [ U ] the maternal instinct
